title: Metrizing Fairness. (arXiv:2205.15049v3 [cs.LG] UPDATED)
abstract: We study supervised learning problems for predicting properties of individuals who belong to one of two demographic groups, and we seek predictors that are fair according to statistical parity. This means that the distributions of the predictions within the two groups should be close with respect to the Kolmogorov distance, and fairness is achieved by penalizing the dissimilarity of these two distributions in the objective function of the learning problem. In this paper, we showcase conceptual and computational benefits of measuring unfairness with integral probability metrics (IPMs) other than the Kolmogorov distance. Conceptually, we show that the generator of any IPM can be interpreted as a family of utility functions and that unfairness with respect to this IPM arises if individuals in the two demographic groups have diverging expected utilities. We also prove that the unfairness-regularized prediction loss admits unbiased gradient estimators if unfairness is measured by the square

ret.translated_abstract: 我们研究了预测属于两个人口群体之一的个体属性的监督学习问题，并寻求公平的预测器，使其在统计平等方面是公平的。这意味着两个群体中预测的分布应该在Kolmogorov距离方面接近，并且通过在学习问题的目标函数中惩罚这两个分布的不相似度来实现公平性。在本文中，我们展示了使用除Kolmogorov距离以外的积分概率度量（IPM）测量不公平性的概念和计算好处。概念上，我们表明任何IPM的生成器都可以解释为效用函数族，并且如果两个人口群体的个体预期效用发散，则相对于此IPM的不公平性就会出现。我们还证明，如果不公平性由平方测量，则不公平性正则化的预测损失具有无偏梯度估计器。
ret.tldr: 本文研究了监督学习问题，旨在预测属于两个人口群体之一的个体属性，并寻求公平的预测器，以实现统计平等。通过使用除Kolmogorov距离以外的积分概率度量（IPM）测量不公平性，我们在概念上和计算上展示了一些好处，证明了相对于这些IPM的不公平性会在两个人口群体的个体预期效用发散时出现，并且如果不公平性由平方测量，则不公平性正则化的预测损失具有无偏梯度估计器。
